text: Which of the following is not the role of government in agricultural production?
explanation: Labour in agriculture is the workforce ,or people that are required to perform Agricultural task.

text: Agricultural extension programme would succeed in disseminating new ideas to farmers except if the programme

options.A: is based on research tested on local conditions
options.B: involves the people for which the programme is planned
options.C: involved only the support to highly trained agricultural extension specialist
options.D: is not kept flexible to contemporary technology

explanation: Agricultural extension programmes aims at teaching farmers with different methods and with the aids of technology about new farming techniques.

text: Which of the following is not a quality for selecting livestock?
explanation: Mortality rate is the number of death in a given area.

text: Investments with long life span in agricultural economics are otherwise known as
explanation: Capital can be goods or money used in a business for production and to yield profit over a long Period of time.Capital is a factor of production.

text: Under normal circumstances, the concept of consumer sovereignty in agriculture implies that

options.A: the consumer and not the farmer determines what to produce
options.B: both the farmer and the consumer determine what to produce
options.C: the consumer and not the farmer owns the means of production
options.D: the environmental factors determine what to produce

explanation: What to produce is determined by the consumer ,The farmer produce are for the consumer therefore he will only produce what the consumer wants.

text: A farmer uses his agricultural loans for the following except
explanation: Agricultural loan can be inform of cash or subsidy ,the aim of such loan is to increase a farmer's Output.

text: Which of the following activities is correct about agricultural extension agent?

options.A: teaching farmers the management of exotic breeds of animals and crops
options.B: educating farmers on the use of improved inputs and techniques in agriculture
options.C: training school leavers to become professional farmers
options.D: encouraging graduates to take up agriculture as a profession

explanation: Agricultural extension agents teach farmers with different methods and with the aids of technology about new farming techniques.

text: Which of the following is not a breed of cattle?
explanation: There is nothing like sokoto red ,what we have is Red sokoto which is a breed of goat.

text: Which of the following may cause disease in a fish pond?
explanation: Poor management practices such as ;pollution of ponds ,use of infected equipments can cause diseases in a fish pond.

text: Which of the following is not a sign of animal approaching parturition?
explanation: Animal approaching parturition(act of giving birth) should have an increase in milk production due to Increase in progesterone and estrogen.

text: The length of oestrus cycle (in days) in goat is
explanation: Oestrus cycle is the period an animal is ready to mate.

text: Daily management routines in poultry include the following except
explanation: Debeaking, beak trimming (also spelt beak-trimming), or beak conditioning is the partial removal of the beak of poultry,

text: When a cockerel is castrated, it becomes a
explanation: Capon is a castrated Cockerel ,this is done to increase it's meat yield.

text: Which of the following characteristics is not correct of pigs?
explanation: Pigs are animal ,Land is a free gift of nature.

text: The best control ensure for rinderpest disease in cattle is
explanation: Rinderpest disease is a viral disease ,Virus don't die they only become inactive in a non living medium .So the best way to control it is vaccination.

text: Which of the following is not an advantage of drip-irrigation?

options.A: fertilizers can be applied through the system
options.B: there is reduction in the concentration of salt in the root zone
options.C: the system operates on a much lower line pressure than sprinkler system
options.D: its efficiency on water distribution in steep slopes is poor

explanation: Drip-irrigation is poor when applied in a steep slope.It is suited for plain lands.

text: The windmill is normally used as a source of power in
explanation: Windmill is a machine which translates linear motion of wind to rotational motion by means of adjustable vanes called sails,it's converts wind energy into mechanical energy .

text: The most appropriate farm machinery for breaking soil is the
explanation: Plough is a device pulled through the ground in order to break it open into furrows for planting.

text: One of the limitation of mechanization of farms is

options.A: reduction in the cost of production
options.B: exposure of soil to the effects of climate

explanation: Mechanization is the use of machinery to replace human or animal labour, especially in agriculture .This required lot of capital thereby increasing the cost of production.

text: The physical properties of soil include the following except
explanation: Physical properties of soil include color, texture, structure, porosity, density, consistence, temperature, and air

text: Which of the following is not component of soil?
explanation: Texture is a property of soil and not component.

text: The soil nutrient which is important as a constituent of plant proteins and hormones is
explanation: constituents of protein includes ;carbon, hydrogen, nitrogen, oxygen or sulfur.

text: During the processes of soil formation, the cracks or crevices that are first noticed on the rocks are normally caused by
explanation: Increase in temperature cause breakdown of rocks ,this process is called weathering.

text: A soil with the PH range of 6.1 to 6.9 can be described as
explanation: PH scale is number 1-14.1-6.9 is acidic ,the close it is to 1 the more acidic it becomes and the closer it is to 6.9 the less /slightly acidic it becomes ,while 7 is neutral ,8-12 is alkaline and the closer it is to 12 the highly it gets and the closer it is to 8 the less/slightly alkaline it is.

text: The main purpose of including leguminous crops in pastures is to serve as a source of
explanation: Leguminous crops contain high level of protein.

text: Which of the following is not normally a pasture crop?
explanation: Mucuna pruriens is a tropical legume and not a pasture.

text: The damage to the stem of maize plants resulting in hollowness and lodging is most likely caused by
explanation: A stemborer (stem borer) is any insect larva, or arthropod, that bores into plant stems.

text: The most common soil mineral found in all crystalline rocks and a main constituent of granite and sandstone is
explanation: Quartz is an abundant soil mineral ,It occurs in a variety of forms, both crystalline(in granite) and amorphous(in sandstone).

text: A soil with pH2 can be described as
explanation: PH scale is number 1-14.1-6.9 is acidic ,the close it is to 1 the more acidic it becomes and the closer it is to 6.9 the less /slightly acidic it becomes ,while 7 is neutral ,8-12 is alkaline and the closer it is to 12 the highly it gets and the closer it is to 8 the less/slightly alkaline it is.

text: Which of the following will be responsible for the poor yield of fertile soil in a high rainfall area?

options.B: very low pH value of land

explanation: leaching is the loss of water-soluble plant nutrients from the soil, due to rain and irrigation.

text: Crop rotation has the following effects on the soil except
explanation: crop rotation is the growing of different crops in succession on a piece of land to avoid exhausting the soil and to control weeds, pests, and diseases.

text: Which of the following is an example of igneous rock?
explanation: Granite is a group of igneous and plutonic rocks composed primarily of feldspar and quartz.

text: A biotic factor influencing agricultural production is
explanation: Biotic factors are the living organism like predators ,micro organism,while abiotic factors are the Non living component like sun ,rainfall ,wind etc.

text: Which of the following nutrient element is a macro-nutrient?
explanation: Macro nutrients are nutrients required in large quantities in plants eg Nitrogen , Phosphorus etc

text: In encouraging farmers to produce more of a particular crop, the Nigerian government has helped farmers in marketing that crop through the establishment of

options.B: markets for the sale of crops

explanation: Marketing Board can be defined as an organization set up by a government to regulate the buying and selling of a certain commodity within a specified area.

text:
The diagram above shows parts of a plough.
Study it and answer this question.
The part labelled I in the diagram is the
explanation: The diagram above is generally a Plough ,A plough or plow is a farm tool forloosening or turning the soil before sowing seed or planting.part labelled I is the mould board ,it is the curved blade of a plough, which turns over the furrow.A plough may have a wooden, iron or steel frame, with a blade attached to cut and loosen the soil.

text:
Study the diagram above and answer question
The crop associated with the diagram above is?
explanation: Hevea brasiliensis, the Pará rubber tree, sharinga tree, seringueira, or, most commonly, the rubber tree or rubber plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the spurge family Euphorbiaceae. It is the most economically important member of the genus Hevea because the milky latex extracted from the tree is the primary source of natural rubber.

text: During which of the following plant propagation methods is the tool represented used?
explanation: The picture shown above is a bidding knife .A budding knife is a small knife with a type of spatula at the other end of the handle.Budding, often called bud grafting, is an artificial method of asexual or vegetative propagation in plants. Like grafting, this method is employed to convert one plant (the rootstock) into another plant type with desirable characteristics. Similarly, the resulting plants

text:
Study the diagram above and answer question
The farm tool associated with the diagram above is
explanation: The tree in this question is a rubber tree and the process depicted is rubber tapping. Rubber tapping is the process by which latex is collected from a rubber tree. The latex is harvested by slicing a groove into the bark of the tree at a depth of one-quarter inch with a hooked knife and peeling back the bark

text: From the curve above, at what point is it advisable for the farmer to stop further addition of input?
explanation: At III law of Diminishing returns sets in.Diminishing returns, also called law of diminishing returns or principle of diminishing marginal productivity, economic law stating that if one input in the production of a commodity is increased while all other inputs are held fixed, a point will eventually be reached at which additions of the input yield progressively smaller, or diminishing, increases in output.

text: The primary role of agriculture is the provision of

options.C: food for man and his animals

explanation: The primary role is the production of food ,all other roles/functions are secondary

text: In subsistence agriculture,
explanation: In Subsistence farming produce is only for the farmer and his families so the surplus produced is small.

text: The recommended agricultural practice in farm settlement scheme is
explanation: Mixed farming is a type of farming which involves both the growing of crops and the raising of livestock.

text: Government agricultural policies include the following except

options.A: increasing the production of food crops and animals
options.B: increasing the efficiency of production of export crops
options.C: supplying raw materials for use in local industries
options.D: increasing the number of peasant farmers

explanation: Government agricultural policies are aimed at increasing farmer's output thereby improving the lives of farmer.

text: Agricultural uses of land include
explanation: Silviculture is the practice of controlling the growth, composition/structure, and quality of forests to meet values and needs, specifically timber production.

text: Capital in agriculture includes the following item except
explanation: Capital can be goods, Equipments or money used in a business for production and to yield profit over a long Period of time.Capital is a factor of production.

text: The quantity of rice that a consumer is willing and able to buy during a given period is simply the consumer's
explanation: Demand is the quantity of goods a buyer is willing to buy at a particular price and at a particular period of time.

text: Artificial scarcity of agricultural produce is often caused by the following marketing agents except
explanation: Artificial scarcity is a purposeful reduction of supply even though demand is high to maximize prices

text: Given a normal situation, what effect will an increase in the supply of cowpea have on its market price? The price
explanation: According to he law of supply ,the higher the supply the lower the pieces of goods/services and vice versa.

text: Marketing processes do not include
explanation: Marketing processes involve ways to moving or making goods available from the producer to the final consumer.

text: Which of the following is not a source of farm power?
explanation: Sources of farm power are ways in which energy used for carrying out farming activities are generated from

text: Farm surveying can be defined as the

options.A: leveling of land during road construction
options.B: sighting of structures through a theodolite
options.C: making measurements on land from which maps are drawn
options.D: estimation of the type and properties of soil on a farm

explanation: Farm Surveying is defined as the process by which measurement of land is made on the farm.

text: Which of the following sources of farm power is most flexible and adaptable to farm operations?
explanation: Human power is the main source for operating small implements and tools at the farm. Stationary work like chaff cutting, lifting, water, threshing, winnowing etc are also done by manual labour.

text: The most efficient irrigation method on large scale farms involve the use of
explanation: An overhead irrigation system is a lot like a lawn sprinkler -- the basic principle is the same. Water is pumped in under pressure and sprayed down onto the plants from flat spray nozzles.

text: What is the main use of a gunter's chain?

options.B: determining the depth of soil moisture
options.C: calculating the slope of the land

explanation: Gunter's chain is a distance measuring device used for surveying.

text: An example of grain legume is
explanation: Grain legumes, also called pulses, are plants belonging to the family Leguminosae (alternatively Fabaceae) which are grown primarily for their edible seeds.Grain legumes include beans, lentils, lupins, peas, and peanuts.

text: Cassava is mainly propagated by
explanation: Cassava stems are referred to as cuttings ,the stems are cut and planted directly into the soil.

text: Which of the following groups of crops requires a nursery?
explanation: Nursery, place where plants are grown for transplanting, for use as stock for budding etc.

text: To which of the following crops does the term 'ginning' apply?
explanation: Ginning is the process of removing the seeds and debris from cotton.

text: The scientific name for guinea grass is
explanation: guinea grass is a pasture.Panicum maximum is a perennial, tufted grass with a short, creeping rhizome. The stems of this robust grass can reach a height of up to 2 m. As the stems bend and nodes touch the ground, roots and new plants are formed. The leaf sheaths are found at the bases of the stems and are covered in fine hairs.

text: The national tree-planting campaign is aimed at stimulating
explanation: Afforestation is planting of trees where they have not been planted before.

text: The most common grazing system in West Africa is
explanation: rotational grazing is the process whereby livestock are moved to portions of the pasture, called paddocks, while the other portions rest.

text: Smut disease of cereals is caused by a
explanation: The smuts are multicellular fungi characterized by their large numbers of teliospores.

text: Improvement of yam through breeding is difficult because

options.A: it possesses no sexual reproductive system
options.B: naturally growing types have to be used
options.C: its rapid multiplication is very difficult

explanation: Yam does not have any sexual reproductive system

text: Leguminous cover crops do not

options.A: bind the soil particles together through their roots
options.B: increase the nitrogen content of soils
options.C: aid in improving the soil organic matter content

explanation: Leguminous cover cropping helps to prevent erosion , supply nitrogen etc but does not have a negative effect on soil microbial population.

text: Maize is a very important crop because apart from serving as a staple, it

options.A: is ploughed into the soil to increase fertility
options.B: can be processes into corn flakes
options.C: forms the base of most livestock feeds
options.D: is used for producing germ oil

explanation: Most livestock feed on maize and their feed contains about 40% of maize which is a source of carbohydrate.

text: Andropogon gayanus is commonly called
explanation: Gamba grass is a pasture .Andropogon gayanusAndropogon gayanus is a species of grass native to most of the tropical and sub-tropical savannas of Africa.

text: Pasture crops are best used in preparing hay

options.A: when they are two weeks old
options.D: after they have started to dry up

explanation: After seed maturation they are cut and then converted to Hay. Hay is grass, legumes, or other herbaceous plants that have been cut and dried to be stored for use as animal fodder, particularly for large grazing animals raised as livestock.

text: Which of the following is not a characteristic of a good pasture?
explanation: A good pasture has low quality grass.

text: Plant breeders aim at obtaining the following except

options.D: uniformity in the time of maturity

explanation: Plant breeding is the science of changing the traits of plants in order to produce desired characteristics, such as tolerance to bad climatic condition,early maturity and resistance to pest and diseases.

text: The most active agent of physical weathering in arid regions is
explanation: A region is arid when it is characterized by a severe lack of available water,and high temperature to the extent of hindering or preventing the growth and development of plant and animal life.

text: Birds temporarily store their food in the
explanation: Crop is a part of the digestive tract, essentially an enlarged part of the esophagus. As with most other organisms that have a crop, it is used to temporarily store food.

text: Animal which chew the cud are
explanation: Cud is partly digested food returned from the first stomach of ruminants to the mouth for further chewing.

text: Spermatozoa are produced in the
explanation: The testicles (also called testes or gonads) are the male sex glands. They are located behind the penis in a pouch of skin called the scrotum. The testicles produce and store sperm, and they are also the body's main source of male hormones (testosterone).

text: Which of the following is not a sign of heat in farm animals?
explanation: Heat refers to the period an animal is ready to mate ,Udder enlargement is not a sign of heat rather a sign of disease

text: The act of giving birth in farm animals is called
explanation: Parturtion is the process of giving birth in animals.

text: The mating of a white fulani bull and an N'dama cow could be termed?
explanation: Animal breeding is producing improved breeds of domesticated animals by improving their genotypes through selective breeding.In-breeding refers to the mating of more closely related individuals within the same breed for 4-6 generations.Line breeding is the mating animals that are more distantly related which can be traced back to one common ancestor. Examples: Cousins Grandparents to grand offspring.Out breeding is the breeding of unrelated animals is generally of two types:Crossbreeding is the mating of two animals of different breeds. Superior traits that results in the crossbred progeny from crossbreeding are called hybrid vigor or heterosis.Grading up is the breeding of animals of two different breeds where the animals of an indigenous breed/genetic group is mated by an improved pure breed for several generations towards attaining the superior traits of the improved breed.White Fulani and N'dama cows are two different species of cow with desirable characteristics;N'Dama has short, slender limbs, with hooves strong enough to be used for traction work. The cows have modest udders with fine teats.While in the White Fulani cow the general shallowness of the body and lack of width give the breed a leggy appearance. This characteristic of the breed has been described as an adaptation to long distance trekking in the pastoral management . The breed is of interest in that it is more tolerant to heat as compared to N'Dama and Gudali, more resistant to dermatophilosis than the Muturu and N'Dama breeds, resistant to intestinal helminth parasites, and has low mortality rate.

text: Which of the following factors usually affects the colour of egg yolk?
explanation: The type of feed birds feed on is a major determinant of egg's colour.

text: Management practices in a piggery include the following except

options.B: regular cleaning of feed and water troughs

explanation: Vaccination is not done weekly and it depends on various factors like age ,outbreak of diseases etc.

text: The process of stopping a young animal from milk and placing it under hand feeding is
explanation: Weaning is the process of gradually introducing an infant human or another mammal to what will be its adult diet while withdrawing the supply of its mother's milk. The process takes place only in mammals.
